meanings.definition: To take away power or authority from someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to disendower the corrupt official.
meanings.sent2: The council voted to disendower the mayor after the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy used her magic to disendower the bossy elf.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to disendower the towering trees.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's nemesis had a plan to disendower the city's defenses.

meanings.definition: To strip of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The dictator sought to disendower all opposition in the country.
meanings.sent2: The court order would disendower the company of its assets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to disendower the dog of its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The sudden blackout seemed to disendower the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer's spell aimed to disendower the hero's magical abilities.

meanings.definition: To deprive of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The new law would disendower the president of certain executive powers.
meanings.sent2: The betrayal by his closest advisor disendowered the king.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to disendower the teacher's control of the class.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events disendowered the villain of his allies.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious potion seemed to disendower the wizard's ability to cast spells.
